page.title: 06Housing in Kippax
page.content: Most of the houses in Kippax are semi-detatched and then the next largest group are detachrd. Then there is terraced and second to last are bungalows. Not many people live in flats. The blocks of flats are off from Kippax Main Street. The flats are not high rise, they only have three stories. In Kippax there are more private houses than council houses. Most of the council houses are in an estate called the 'Wimpeys'. There are twice as many private than council houses. The reason for this is that people prefer to own their own houses. The average age of houses in Kippax is 25 years. Some of the houses are 70,80 or 90 years old. The oldest house is Kippax Hall, which is derelict. It is Victorian. The newest houses are on the outskirts of Kippax. There are several new private estates.
